title: If you had a 'delete all history' button for life, would you press it? - Quora

response.answer_text: No, I do not want to act like an idiot. I spent tons of time to study, write, think and feel sorrow or sweetness in my life. You delete equals to you wipe everything happened in the past. You become a creature instead of a person. Who knows if your thereafter life must be better than the life you wiped out?

No. That experience *is* your life. Even the bad parts contributed to future decisions to be better. Ultimately you’re a sum of your experiences. Deleting those experiences may leave a fresh canvas — but you’d be hollow, meaningless and *really* boring at parties.
